intro: Memecylon edule var. leucanthum, commonly known as white-flowered memecylon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are often clustered in terminal panicles, and the fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
